Profiler.summary: NOTE Experimental The Profiler interface of the JS Self-Profiling API enables you to create a profile of some part of your web application's execution.

ProfilerProfiler.summary: NOTE Experimental The Profiler() constructor creates a new object.

remarks.para: Once created, the new profiler will start collecting samples.

ProfilerSamplebufferfull.summary: The samplebufferfull event of the interface is fired when the number of samples the profiler has recorded matches the maxBufferSize value passed to the profiler's constructor.

remarks.para: After this event fires, the profiler will not record any more samples.
This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

ProfilerStop.summary: NOTE Experimental The stop() method of the interface stops the profiler and returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} which resolves to the profile itself.
ProfilerStop.returns: A that resolves to an object containing the profile data. The format and interpretation of this object is described in Profile anatomy and format.
